headline: China Detains 18 Workers From Crown Resorts, an Australian Casino Company
abstract: The employees were arrested in raids that appeared to be linked to measures to restrict the promotion of gambling in China.

headline: Scotland Embraces Gay Politicians in a Profound Cultural Shift
abstract: Once known as a bastion of social conservatism, Scotland has changed dramatically in a generation, not least through the election of gay candidates.

headline: Criticism of the News Media Takes On a More Sinister Tone
abstract: Coverage of this year’s presidential campaign can certainly be faulted, but there is danger in the incendiary talk used by Donald Trump.

headline: Rolling Stone Stays Focused as Defamation Trial Is Set to Begin
abstract: The first of two cases against the magazine and its publisher over a discredited article about an alleged gang rape at the University of Virginia opens Monday.

headline: East of Mosul, Kurdish Troops Advance on ISIS-Held Villages
abstract: About 4,000 pesh merga forces are involved in the operation to retake 10 Iraqi villages, the opening phase of a battle that could take weeks or months.

headline: Thailand Says Bhumibol’s Cremation Is a Year Away, With Heir’s Coronation to Follow
abstract: The crown prince has asked that King Bhumibol’s cremation be held after a one-year period of mourning, with his own coronation to come later, an official said.

headline: Answers to Questions About 403(b) Plans
abstract: A 403(b) plan is similar to the more familiar 401(k), but it is subject to less stringent securities regulations.

headline: Las Vegas, Known for Excess, Was Perfect Backdrop for Presidential Debate
abstract: The event cost $8 million to stage and was almost a year in the making, a reflection of America’s extravagant process of choosing a president.

headline: Why Wait a Month for a Sofa That’s Not Even What You Wanted?
abstract: Start-ups are trying to break off pieces of the furniture market by offering custom sizes and colors, or more affordable prices, and quicker turnaround.

headline: Egyptian Army Officer Killed Outside Home; Militant Group Is Suspected
abstract: The shooting, the highest-profile attack against an army official since 2013, was thought to be linked to the officer’s role in destroying tunnels used by Hamas.

headline: WikiLeaks’ Gift to American Democracy
abstract: Revelations about Donald Trump and the Clinton campaign have pulled back the curtain on the political-celebrity mythmaking the media too often abets.

headline: Police in India Kill 24 Maoist Rebels
abstract: A battle between officers and the rebels took place at what the police said appeared to be a training camp in a remote area of eastern India. An activist called it staged.

headline: Freed Sailors Recount Years of Torture at the Hands of Somali Pirates
abstract: The crew members, released after four and a half years in captivity, recalled how they were beaten with poles and ate rats to survive in the desert.

headline: Rodrigo Duterte, Pushing Split With U.S., Counters Philippines’ Deep Ties
abstract: Mr. Duterte’s threats have tapped a strain of resentment among some Filipinos, but the nations’ close relationship makes it unlikely that any will follow him on the path to divorce.

headline: Shouts Greet Migrants in the Streets of France: ‘We Don’t Want Them’
abstract: Tiny French communities like Croisilles are being forced to deal firsthand with Europe’s migrant crisis as officials break down a camp in Calais.

headline: China Oceanwide Dips Into American Insurance, Buying Genworth
abstract: The Chinese conglomerate agreed to buy Genworth Financial of Virginia for $2.7 billion as the Chinese shopping spree in the United States continues.

headline: U.N. Plans to Pay Victims of Cholera Outbreak It Caused in Haiti
abstract: A proposed $400 million aid package comes two months after the United Nations acknowledged that it helped spread the deadly disease in the impoverished nation.

headline: Kenya Spares the Lives of Everyone on Its Death Row
abstract: President Uhuru Kenyatta of Kenya commuted 2,747 convicts’ death sentences to life in prison on Monday, in a country that has not actually executed anyone since 1987.

headline: Austin McChord of Datto: It’s Not Awesome Till It’s Awesome
abstract: Austin McChord, C.E.O. of the data protection company Datto, says he resists the trend of automatically handing out praise and instead saves it for exceptional achievements.

headline: 35 Turks With Diplomatic Passports Seek Asylum in Germany
abstract: The aftermath of a failed coup in Turkey has complicated relations with Germany, amid tensions over the flow of refugees from Syria.

headline: College Towns Can Be Attractive Later in Life
abstract: University communities have advantages like intellectual stimulation, cultural amenities and a healthy economic base without a high price tag.

headline: Goldman’s Earnings Impress but Don’t Fully Convince
abstract: Trading, share buybacks and operating leverage all helped the investment bank to its best showing in a year-and-a-half.

headline: Nicolás Maduro Flexes New Budgetary Muscles in Venezuela
abstract: A legal expert called the budget “openly unconstitutional” after a Supreme Court decision stripped the National Assembly of its power of the purse.

headline: Whoever Wins the White House, This Year’s Big Loser Is Email
abstract: The exposure of the Clinton campaign’s internal emails shows that a ubiquitous, and vulnerable, communication tool is ready for the scrap heap.

headline: Why Mosul Is Critical in the Battle Against ISIS
abstract: Iraq’s second-largest city was once home to more than two million residents before the Islamic State claimed it as a stronghold of its self-proclaimed caliphate.

headline: Airstrikes by Saudi-Led Coalition Kill Dozens in Western Yemen
abstract: Many prisoners were said to be killed in an attack by coalition jets on a security complex in Al Hudaydah, on the Red Sea coast.

headline: Canada and E.U. Sign Trade Deal, Bucking Resistance to Globalization
abstract: The deal nearly fell apart at the last minute because of opposition from the Wallonia region of Belgium.

headline: Protests Erupt in Morocco Over Fish Vendor’s Death in Garbage Compactor
abstract: King Mohammed VI ordered an investigation into the death of Mouhcine Fikri, who had jumped into a garbage truck after his merchandise was confiscated.

headline: U.S. Tells Families of Istanbul Consulate Staff to Leave Turkey
abstract: The State Department issued the order because of increased security threats from terrorist organizations.

headline: Pro-Russian Candidate Leads Moldova Presidential Vote but Faces Runoff
abstract: The candidate, Igor Dodon, finished far ahead of pro-Western challengers, but failed to win the outright majority needed to avoid a runoff election next month.

headline: General Electric Plans to Merge Its Oil and Gas Division With Baker Hughes
abstract: The deal would give G.E. a big stake in the oil business, and give Baker Hughes shareholders stock in a larger, healthier company and a dividend.

headline: CenturyLink, a Network Provider, to Acquire Level 3, a Rival
abstract: In a $25 billion deal, the two companies will combine to create one of the largest communications providers for businesses.

headline: Kidney Fund Seen Insisting on Donations, Contrary to Government Deal
abstract: The charity that helps people get lifesaving dialysis has a special arrangement that has helped it grow large, but it may not be holding up its end of the deal.

headline: Seeking Ownership of Both the Information and the Superhighway
abstract: The AT&T-Time Warner merger raises concerns about the combination of a huge wireless company with a major movie studio and popular cable channels.

headline: Venezuela Slowed by Strike in Campaign to Oust President Nicolás Maduro
abstract: The president’s ruling party and the opposition tried to spin the effectiveness of the 12-hour strike, which was weaker than Wednesday’s mobilization.

headline: Push to Tweak Time Zone Gains Momentum in Spain
abstract: Lawmakers have argued that an extra hour of afternoon sunlight would have social and health benefits and help the nation save millions on electricity.

headline: Aligning Your Investments With What Motivates You
abstract: In finance, phi is a way for investors to quantify how their motivations, or the motivations of their money managers, will affect long-term returns.

headline: Airbnb Sues Over New Law Regulating New York Rentals
abstract: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has signed a bill that will impose fines up to $7,500 on hosts who rent out housing for fewer than 30 days.

headline: Tips for Choosing the Right Health Plan
abstract: Here are some things to consider when choosing the best health plan for you.

headline: Mexico Arrests Ex-Chief of Police in City Where 43 Students Disappeared
abstract: The former chief, Felipe Flores Velázquez, was in charge of the police force in Iguala, where the students vanished in 2014.

headline: Awaiting Next U.S. President: A Splintered Middle East in ‘Free Fall’
abstract: The next president faces problems more daunting than any in a generation, as the old order has given way to a kaleidoscopic mix of alliances, rivalries and overlapping crises.
